SEARCH
Package bn.base

Class BayesianNetwork

java.lang.Object
bn.base.BayesianNetwork
All Implemented Interfaces:
BayesianNetwork, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AIMAAlarmNetwork, AIMAWetGrassNetwork, Project3SmallNetwork
public class BayesianNetwork extends Object implements BayesianNetwork, Cloneable
Base implementation of a BayesianNetwork as a graph of Nodes each of which corresponds to a RandomVariable with a CPT.
See Also:
  • BayesianNetwork
  • RandomVariable
  • CPT

  • Field Details

    • nodes

      protected Set<BayesianNetwork.Node> nodes
      The Set of Nodes representing this BayesianNetwork. We use an ArraySet since once we have created the network, it never changes.

  • Constructor Details

    • BayesianNetwork

      public BayesianNetwork(int size)
      Construct and return a new (empty) BayesianNetwork initialized to contain the given number of RandomVariables. This is used to pre-allocate for storing them, which may be more efficient if you know the size in advance.

    • BayesianNetwork

      public BayesianNetwork()
      Construct and return a new (empty) BayesianNetwork.

    • BayesianNetwork

      public BayesianNetwork(Collection<RandomVariable> variables)
      Construct and return a new (empty) BayesianNetwork initialized to contain the given Collection (List, Set, ...) of RandomVariables.

  • Method Details

    • size

      public int size()
      Return the size (number of nodes == number of RandomVariables) in this BayesianNetwork.

    • add

      public void add(RandomVariable var)
      Add a node for the given RandomVariable to this BayesianNetwork. Note: This is called when a variable entity is read in an XMLBIF file.
      Specified by:
      add in interface BayesianNetwork

    • getNodeForVariable

      public BayesianNetwork.Node getNodeForVariable(RandomVariable var)
      Return the Node for given RandomVariable from this BayesianNetwork.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException

    • getVariableByName

      public RandomVariable getVariableByName(String name)
      Return the RandomVariable with the given name from this BayesianNetwork. Only tests variables that implement the Named interface.

      This is currently only used when reading a network from an XMLBIF file. If you used it more heavily, you'd probably want to index the variables more efficiently.

      Specified by:
      getVariableByName in interface BayesianNetwork
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException

    • getVariables

      public Set<RandomVariable> getVariables()
      Return the RandomVariables in this BayesianNetwork as a List. Current implementation uses an ArrayList for this, and the order of the variables will be the same as the order they were added to the network.
      Specified by:
      getVariables in interface BayesianNetwork

    • connect

      public void connect(RandomVariable var, Set<RandomVariable> parents, CPT cpt)
      Connect the node for the given RandomVariable to the nodes for the given set of parent RandomVariables, with the given CPT. Note: This is called when a definition entity is read in an XMLBIF file.
      Specified by:
      connect in interface BayesianNetwork

    • getChildren

      public Set<RandomVariable> getChildren(RandomVariable X)
      Returns the Set of RandomVariables that are the children of the given RandomVariable. This is done in a really wasteful way, so you'd be better off doing something different for use in a certain kind of sampling...
      Specified by:
      getChildren in interface BayesianNetwork

    • getParents

      public Set<RandomVariable> getParents(RandomVariable X)
      Returns the Set of RandomVariables that are the parents of the given RandomVariable. Also done inefficiently if you are calling it frequently.
      Specified by:
      getParents in interface BayesianNetwork

    • getProbability

      public double getProbability(RandomVariable X, Assignment e)
      Return the probability stored in the CPT for the given RandomVariable, given the Values of its parents (and itself) in the given ArrayMapAssignment.
      Specified by:
      getProbability in interface BayesianNetwork

    • setProbability

      public void setProbability(RandomVariable X, Assignment e, double p)
      Set the probability stored in the CPT for the given RandomVariable, given the Values of its parents (and itself) in the given ArrayMapAssignment.
      Specified by:
      setProbability in interface BayesianNetwork

    • getVariablesSortedTopologically

      public List<RandomVariable> getVariablesSortedTopologically()
      Sort the given list of RandomVariables topologically with respect to this BayesianNetwork, and return the resulting list. I thought about just having a topsort method, into which one would pass a collection of RandomVariables (e.g., from getVariables()), but there was just too much converting between RandomVariables and Nodes for that. The only reason you ever topsort is to topsort the entire list of variables once at the start of inference, so why not just do that here.

      This implementation uses the DFS algorithm described in Wikipedia and attributed to Tarjan.

      Specified by:
      getVariablesSortedTopologically in interface BayesianNetwork

    • visit

      protected void visit(BayesianNetwork.Node n, List<RandomVariable> L, Set<BayesianNetwork.Node> visited)
      RecursiveNoCycleCheck step of topological sort procedure.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Return the String representation of this BayesianNetwork.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • copy

      public BayesianNetwork copy()
      Return a copy of this BayesianNetwork that uses the same RandomVariables, but has its own copies of the CPTs (initialized to this network's values). This method is used by some learning algorithms, such as EM.
      Specified by:
      copy in interface BayesianNetwork

    • main

      public static void main(String[] argv)
